messages.content: She felt something and likes me but loves other man. She lied about it for a month, treated me like junk, but then started to become warmer and then said that we should stop communicating because she is betraying another man when becoming closer to me. I said that we can just talk and it will be ok. She agreed. Then we talked some days, she became indifferent, I got angry and blocked her everywhere. Was it smart move or I just gave up?

It depends on your goals. If you wanted to preserve your relationship with her, then it might have been a smart move to give her some space and not be so angry. However, if your goal was to end the relationship, then blocking her everywhere might have been the best option. It depends on what you want to achieve.
I did it because I was angry and disappointed. She treated me like a doormat
It's understandable, but it might not have been the best way to handle the situation.
So, what was the best option?

It depends on your goals. If you wanted to preserve your relationship with her, then it might have been a smart move to give her some space and not be so angry. However, if your goal was to end the relationship, then blocking her everywhere might have been the best option. It depends on what you want to achieve.
My goal was to forget her. Nobody ever treated me like this. But we have a strong bond and I never felt something like this for a long time.
It sounds like you are dealing with a lot of complicated emotions. It might be helpful to talk to a professional to explore your feelings and come up with a plan going forward.
Maybe I should talk to her and continue building a bond after week or two?
That might be a good idea, but it's ultimately up to you.
Why is it a good idea?

It would give you both time to cool off and allow you to express your feelings in a more thoughtful way. It might also help you to understand each other better and come to a resolution that works for both of you.
